verses.kjv: In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.
verses.web: In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah, Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.
verses.ct: Ahaz son of Jotham became king of Judah during the 17th year of King Pekah son of Remaliah's reign.

verses.kjv: Twenty years old was Ahaz when he began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem, and did not that which was right in the sight of the LORD his God, like David his father.
verses.web: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. He didn’t do that which was right in LORD his God’s eyes, like David his father.
verses.ct: Ahaz was 20 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 16 years. Unlike his ancestor David, the LORD his God saw that he was not a good king.

verses.kjv: But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, yea, and made his son to pass through the fire, according to the abominations of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out from before the children of Israel.
verses.web: But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, yes, and made his son to pass through the fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom LORD cast out from before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Instead, he followed the ways of Israel's kings. He even sacrificed his own son in fire — a horrifying practice of the nations the LORD had driven out to make room for Israel.

verses.kjv: And he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.
verses.web: He sacrificed and burned incense in the high places, on the hills, and under every green tree.
verses.ct: He offered sacrifices and burned incense at the pagan high places, on the hilltops, and under every large green tree.

verses.kjv: Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war: and they besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome him.
verses.web: Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to wage war. They besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome him.
verses.ct: During his reign, King Rezin of Syria and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel marched against Jerusalem. They laid siege to Ahaz but couldn't defeat him.

verses.kjv: At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath to Syria, and drave the Jews from Elath: and the Syrians came to Elath, and dwelt there unto this day.
verses.web: At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath to Syria, and drove the Jews from Elath; and the Syrians came to Elath, and lived there, to this day.
verses.ct: Around that same time, King Rezin of Syria recaptured the city of Elath for Syria, driving out all the Jews who lived there. Syrians moved in and have lived there ever since.

verses.kjv: So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, saying, I am thy servant and thy son: come up, and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria, and out of the hand of the king of Israel, which rise up against me.
verses.web: So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria, saying, “I am your servant and your son. Come up and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria, and out of the hand of the king of Israel, who rise up against me.”
verses.ct: Ahaz sent messengers to King Tiglathpileser of Assyria with this plea: "I am your loyal servant and your ally. Come rescue me from the kings of Syria and Israel — they've both turned against me."

verses.kjv: And Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in the house of the LORD, and in the treasures of the king’s house, and sent it for a present to the king of Assyria.
verses.web: Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in LORD’s house, and in the treasures of the king’s house, and sent it for a present to the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: To back up his request, Ahaz gathered all the silver and gold from the LORD's temple and from the royal treasury and sent it as a gift to the king of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria hearkened unto him: for the king of Assyria went up against Damascus, and took it, and carried the people of it captive to Kir, and slew Rezin.
verses.web: The king of Assyria listened to him; and the king of Assyria went up against Damascus, and took it, and carried its people captive to Kir, and killed Rezin.
verses.ct: The king of Assyria agreed. He marched against Damascus, captured it, deported its people to Kir, and killed King Rezin.

verses.kjv: And king Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, and saw an altar that was at Damascus: and king Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest the fashion of the altar, and the pattern of it, according to all the workmanship thereof.
verses.web: King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria, and saw the altar that was at Damascus; and king Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest a drawing of the altar and plans to build it.
verses.ct: King Ahaz then traveled to Damascus to meet with Tiglathpileser. While there, he saw an altar that impressed him, so he sent detailed drawings and construction plans for it to Urijah the priest back in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And Urijah the priest built an altar according to all that king Ahaz had sent from Damascus: so Urijah the priest made it against king Ahaz came from Damascus.
verses.web: Urijah the priest built an altar. According to all that king Ahaz had sent from Damascus, so Urijah the priest made it for the coming of king Ahaz from Damascus.
verses.ct: Urijah the priest built an exact replica of the altar based on the plans King Ahaz had sent, finishing it before Ahaz returned from Damascus.

verses.kjv: And when the king was come from Damascus, the king saw the altar: and the king approached to the altar, and offered thereon.
verses.web: When the king had come from Damascus, the king saw the altar; and the king came near to the altar, and offered on it.
verses.ct: When the king arrived back from Damascus and saw the altar, he walked up to it and made offerings on it.

verses.kjv: And he burnt his burnt offering and his meat offering, and poured his drink offering, and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings, upon the altar.
verses.web: He burned his burnt offering and his meal offering, poured his drink offering, and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings on the altar.
verses.ct: He burned his burnt offering and his grain offering, poured out his drink offering, and splashed the blood of his peace offerings on the altar.

verses.kjv: And he brought also the brasen altar, which was before the LORD, from the forefront of the house, from between the altar and the house of the LORD, and put it on the north side of the altar.
verses.web: The bronze altar, which was before LORD, he brought from the front of the house, from between his altar and LORD’s house, and put it on the north side of his altar.
verses.ct: The original bronze altar that stood before the LORD — positioned between the new altar and the temple — he moved to the north side of his new altar, clearing it out of the way.

verses.kjv: And king Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest, saying, Upon the great altar burn the morning burnt offering, and the evening meat offering, and the king’s burnt sacrifice, and his meat offering, with the burnt offering of all the people of the land, and their meat offering, and their drink offerings; and sprinkle upon it all the blood of the burnt offering, and all the blood of the sacrifice: and the brasen altar shall be for me to enquire by.
verses.web: King Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest, saying, “On the great altar burn the morning burnt offering, the evening meal offering, the king’s burnt offering, his meal offering, with the burnt offering of all the people of the land, their meal offering, and their drink offerings; and sprinkle on it all the blood of the burnt offering, and all the blood of the sacrifice; but the bronze altar will be for me to inquire by.”
verses.ct: Then King Ahaz gave Urijah the priest these orders: "Use the great new altar for the morning burnt offering, the evening grain offering, my personal burnt offering and grain offering, and all the burnt offerings, grain offerings, and drink offerings of the people. Sprinkle all the blood from the burnt offerings and sacrifices on it. As for the bronze altar, I'll keep that for my own personal use to seek guidance."

verses.kjv: Thus did Urijah the priest, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.
verses.web: Urijah the priest did so, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.
verses.ct: Urijah the priest carried out every instruction King Ahaz gave him.

verses.kjv: And king Ahaz cut off the borders of the bases, and removed the laver from off them; and took down the sea from off the brasen oxen that were under it, and put it upon a pavement of stones.
verses.web: King Ahaz cut off the panels of the bases, and removed the basin from off them, and took down the sea from off the bronze oxen that were under it, and put it on a pavement of stone.
verses.ct: King Ahaz also stripped the decorative panels from the bronze stands and removed the basins from on top of them. He took down the great bronze basin called "the Sea" from the bronze oxen that supported it and set it on a stone pavement instead.

verses.kjv: And the covert for the sabbath that they had built in the house, and the king’s entry without, turned he from the house of the LORD for the king of Assyria.
verses.web: He removed the covered way for the Sabbath that they had built in the house, and the king’s entry outside to LORD’s house, because of the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: He also removed the covered walkway used for the Sabbath that had been built at the temple, along with the king's outer entrance to the LORD's temple — all of this to appease the king of Assyria.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Ahaz's reign and all that he did is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings.

verses.kjv: And Ahaz slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Ahaz slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in David’s city, and Hezekiah his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Ahaz died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David. His son Hezekiah became the next king.
